Notice in Revelation chapter 5 in verse number 1 the Bible says and I saw in the right hand of him that sat on the throne a book written within and on the backside sealed with seven seals and I saw a strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice who is worthy to open the book and to loose the seals thereof and no man in heaven nor in earth neither under the earth was able to open the book neither to look thereon and what is John doing verse 4 and I wept much why because no man was found worthy to open and to read the book neither to look therein and one of the elders said unto me weep not behold the lion of the tribe of Judah the root of David hath prevailed to open the book and to loose the seven seals thereof and I beheld and lo in the midst of the throne and of the four beasts and in the midst of the elders stood a lamb as it had been slain having seven horns and seven eyes which are the seven spirits of God sent forth into all the earth and he came and took the book out of the right hand of him that sat upon the throne and when he had taken the book the four beasts and four and twenty elders fell down before the lamb having every one of them harps and golden vials full of odors which are the prayers of saints. In verse 9, it says, they sung a new song, saying, Thou art worthy to take the book and to open the seals thereof, why? For Thou wast slain and hast redeemed us to God by Thy blood out of every kindred and tongue and people and nation, and hast made us unto our God kings and priests, and we shall reign on the earth. And I beheld, and I heard the voice of many angels round about the throne, and the beasts and the elders, and the number of them was ten thousand times ten thousand, and thousands of thousands, saying with a loud voice, Worthy is the Lamb that was slain to receive power and riches and wisdom and strength and honor and glory and blessing, and every creature which is in heaven, and on the earth and under the earth, and such as are in the sea, and all that are in them, heard I saying, Blessing and honor and glory and power be unto him that sitteth upon the throne and upon the Lamb forever and ever. The four beasts said, Amen, and the four and twenty elders fell down and worshipped him that liveth forever and ever. That's our God. He rules and he reigns. The heathen rage. God shall laugh, has them in derision. They hold their fist at God. They think they're victorious. But Jesus says, Be of good cheer, I have overcome the world. When we take in context the entirety of what Jesus says in these few chapters of the Gospel of John, we find that Jesus, there's something to embrace, why? Because Jesus says, I want to prepare you, I'm being deliberate in what I'm speaking to you, I want you to understand that the persecutions are going to come, I want you to understand that the world's going to hate you, I want you to understand that they're going to think, they're going to put you out of the synagogues and the time's going to come when they, the one that thinks that they're killing you is doing God's service and all of these things, and I'm telling you, I want you to have peace and I want you to have joy and I want you to be able to remember these things. There's something to embrace. Listen, this morning, we need to be in the Bible, we need to be in the Bible. There's a lot going on in our world. A lot going on in our world. But I submit to you this morning that our God's still on His throne. He's never going to be overthrown, He's never going to be defeated, He's never going to, He's on His throne and He forever will be. The Bible says, the Lord God omnipotent reigneth. He rules and He reigns. Everything's happening in His time. Everything's falling into place, just as He said it would, because He knows all things.
